channel.title: Golf - European Tour Race to Dubai Show
channel.itunes:summary: Former European Tour professional Robert Lee hosts a weekly Podcast bringing you all the latest golfing news plus a light-hearted look at life behind the scenes on tour. With unparalleled access to all the top players, Robert, with the help of fellow former professionals, will guide you through the European Tours tournaments each week offering listeners the chance to interact with the team and get their questions answered. And if it is tips you are after, some of the worlds best golfers will be on hand to help make your drives longer and your putts more accurate!

item.title: Golf - European Tour Race to Dubai Show - Episode 33 - Series 6
item.itunes:summary: After Marc Warren claimed his first European Tour victory in seven years, Dan Roebuck and Ewen Murray look back at his two shot win at the Made in Denmark at the Himmerland Golf and Spa Resort. We speak exclusively to the Scot after capturing his 3rd European Tour title and also hear from runner-up Bradley Dredge. Home favourite Thomas Bjorn tells us why he's taking the next two weeks off after finishing 4th. Plus Oliver Fisher helps us look ahead to the next event on the schedule - The D+D REAL Czech Masters.

item.title: Golf - European Tour Race to Dubai Show - Episode 32 - Series 6
item.itunes:summary: Robert Lee and Richard Boxall are joined by American broadcaster Bob Bubka to look back at Rory McIlroy's PGA Championship win at Valhalla. We hear from the four-time major winner on his remarkable summer as well as from Phil Mickelson and Rickie Fowler who pushed the Northern Irishman all the way. The guys also discuss the options available to US Ryder Cup captain Tom Watson as he ponders his three captain's picks as the nine automatic spots have now been finalised.

item.title: Golf - European Tour Race to Dubai Show - Episode 26 - Series 31
item.itunes:summary: Robert Lee is joined by Richard Boxall to reflect on the Bridgestone Invitational at Firestone in Akron, which saw Rory McIlroy pip Sergio Garcia to his first World Golf Championship title. We hear from both players, as well as Tiger Woods following his withdrawal after a reoccurrence of his back injury that almost certainly rules him out of the final major of the year, the US PGA Championship this week and The Ryder Cup. Legendary broadcaster Bob Bubka joins us to preview that final major at Valhalla in Louisville Kentucky, as well as talk us through the future of Tiger.

item.title: Golf - European Tour Race to Dubai Show - Episode 30 - Series 6
item.itunes:summary: Robert Lee and Ewen Murray reflect on two events this week â€“ Bernhard Langerâ€™s record breaking wire to wire victory at The Senior Open Championship from Royal Porthcawl and David Horseyâ€™s play-off win at the M2M Russian Open in Moscow. We hear from Langer as well as runner up Colin Montgomerie and speak exclusively to David Horsey about his third European Tour triumph. We also look ahead to this weekâ€™s event, the star studded WGC Bridgestone Invitational in Ohio, with Tiger Woods hoping to defend his title and add to his eight victories at the Firestone Country Club.

item.title: Golf - European Tour Race to Dubai Show - Episode 29 - Series 6
item.itunes:summary: Rory McIlroy won his first Claret Jug with a wire to wire victory edging out Sergio Garcia and Rickie Fowler by two shots on a thrilling final day at Royal Liverpool Golf Course. Robert Lee is joined by European Tour winners Gordon Brand Jnr and Paul Eales to look back at an historic 143rd Open Championship. We hear from the new Open Champion and both runners up, as well as from World number one Adam Scott, 2013 Champion Phil Mickelson and former Hoylake hero Tiger Woods.

Robert Lee is joined by European Tour winners Gordon Brand Jnr and Paul Eales to look back at an historic 143rd Open Championship. We hear from the new Open Champion and both runners up, as well as from World number one Adam Scott, 2013 Champion Phil Mickelson and former Hoylake hero Tiger Woods.

item.title: Golf - European Tour Race to Dubai Show - Episode 28 - Series 6
item.itunes:summary: In one of the biggest weeks in the Race to Dubai calendar, Dan Roebuck and Robert Lee reflect on an impressive win for Justin Rose at the Aberdeen Asset Management Scottish Open. We hear from the highest ranked Englishman in the World, as well as from runner up Kristoffer Broberg, Scotsman Marc Warren who finished 3rd, his compatriot Stephen Gallacher as well as from the others who tied 4th: Matteo Mannasero, Shane Lowry and Tyrrell Hatton. Plus in their preview of the Open Championship at Hoylake, Dan and Robert speak with former Open champion Paul Lawrie and we hear from reigning champion Phil Mickelson and fellow American Rickie Fowler.

item.title: Golf - European Tour Race to Dubai Show - Episode 27 - Series 6
item.itunes:summary: After Graeme McDowell successfully defends his Alstom Open de France title, Robert Lee and Ewen Murray review the action at Le Golf National and how Kevin Stadler threw away his 4 shot lead going into the final round. We hear from both the Northern Irishman and the American, as well as from Thongchai Jaidee, Robert Karlsson, and Matthew Baldwin. Rob and Ewen speak with Wales's Jamie Donaldson about his tied 5th place in Paris, the prospect of making Europeâ€™s Ryder Cup team and his excitement ahead of the two forthcoming Race to Dubai events over Links courses. Ewen Murray shares with us what to expect at the next of those; the Aberdeen Asset Management Scottish Open which takes place this week at Royal Aberdeen.

item.itunes:summary: Two winners at the BMW International Open join Robert Lee and John Hawksworth on this weekâ€™s Race to Dubai Show. We also hear from Justin Rose, Sergio Garcia, Henrik Stenson, Rafa Cabrera-Bello and Gregory Havret.

item.title: Golf - European Tour Race to Dubai Show - Episode 23 - Series 6
item.itunes:summary: Mikael Lundberg joins Robert Lee and Richard Boxall to discuss his stunning 40 foot birdie putt to win the Lyoness Open in Austria. We also hear from home favourite Bernd Wiesberger, who Lundberg beat in a play off. Robert and Richard then turn their attentions to the second major of the year, the US Open, which gets underway at Pinehurst Resort this week. We ask if Phil Mickelson can win his first US Open, or if Rory McIlroy can continue his superb form, with the help of American golf expert Matt Adams.

item.title: Golf - European Tour Race to Dubai Show - Episode 22 - Series 6
item.itunes:summary: Robert Lee and Ewen Murray reflect on Thongchai Jaideeâ€™s dramatic victory at the Nordea Masters in Sweden. The Thai beating Scotlandâ€™s Stephen Gallacher and Franceâ€™s Victor Dubuisson in a play-off to secure his 6th European Tour title â€“ we hear from all three men. We also hear from world number two Henrik Stenson who finished 5th and speak exclusively to an in form and confident Eddie Pepperell after his 6th place finish. Robert and Ewen then turn their attention to the next event on the European Tour, the Lyoness Open in Austria, with the help of the evergreen Miguel Angel Jimenez and defending champion Joost Luiten.

item.title: Golf - European Tour Race to Dubai Show - Episode 21 - Series 6
item.itunes:summary: Double-major winner Rory McIlroy reflects on a remarkable end to an emotional week after his dramatic victory at the BMW PGA Championship at Wentworth. Dan Roebuck and Robert Lee discuss how the Northern Irishman came back from seven shots behind to secure the flagship event on the European Tour for the very first time. We hear from Thomas Bjorn, who threw away a six shot lead, runner-up Shane Lowry, and former champion Luke Donald. We also speak to the leading PGA pro in the Championship, who found himself on the green with McIlroy for the trophy presentation. Plus we preview the Nordea Masters in Sweden with the help of World Number Two Henrik Stenson.

item.title: Golf - European Tour Race to Dubai Show - Episode 20 - Series 6
item.itunes:summary: Defending champion Matteo Manassero joins Dan Roebuck and Robert Lee ahead of this weeks star-studded BMW PGA Championship at Wentworth. The 21 year old Italian discusses his chances of winning back his title against a sparkling field for the diamond edition of the European Tours flagship event. Dan and Robert also reflect on a stunning Spanish Open victory for the age defying Miguel Angel Jimenez, who became the first man over the age of 50 to win on the European Tour. We also hear from Thomas Pieters and Richard Green, who the Spaniard defeated in a three way play-off.

item.title: Golf - European Tour Race to Dubai Show - Episode 19 - Series 6
item.itunes:summary: Robert Lee and Richard Boxall pay their own tributes to caddie Iain McGregor whose sudden death at the Madeira Islands Open puts the game of Golf and sport in general into sharp perspective. Victory in what were unusual circumstances even before the passing of the 52 year old, went to Englands Daniel Brooks, after he beat Scotlandâ€™s Scott Henry in a playoff in what was a 36 hole tournament. We hear exclusively from Brooks on his way to Spain for next weeks event on The Race to Dubai, the Open de Espana, returning to Catalunya after a 5 year break. Robert and Boxy also reflect on the performances of the many Europeans battling it out in the Players Championship, where Martin Kaymer of Germany ended a 4 year winless run, with a single shot victory at Sawgrass.

item.title: Golf - European Tour Race to Dubai Show - Episode 18 - Series 6
item.itunes:summary: Robert Lee and John Hawksworth reflect on Felipe Aguilars amazing 2-2 finish at The Championship in Singapore. We hear from the Chilean, as well as from joint runners up Anders Hansen and David Lipsky who were blown away on the final day after Aguilars stunning 62. We also hear from Indian golfer Rahil Gangjee and a fit again Chris Wood. Analysis and reaction from Laguna National and as always the guys look ahead to the next event in the Race to Dubai, the Madeira Islands Open.

item.title: Golf - European Tour Race to Dubai Show - Episode 17 - Series 6
item.itunes:summary: Robert Lee and Richard Boxall look back at Alexander Levyâ€™s maiden European Tour victory at the Volvo China Open. We hear exclusively from the young Frenchman who tells the show how he has been inspired by Victor Dubuissonâ€™s form this year. We also hear from runner up Tommy Fleetwood, whose 68 in the final round left him four shots back and also from third placed Alvaro Quiros after his best finish of the year. Tied for fifth were two of the big attractions in China, Ian Poulter and Henrik Stenson, we hear from both Ryder Cup stars. The guys then pay their attention to The Championship at Laguna National in Singapore as Brett Rumford defends.

item.title: Golf - European Tour Race to Dubai Show - Episode 16 - Series 6
item.itunes:summary: Robert Lee is joined by John Hawksworth to look back at Lee Westwoods first European Tour win for two years. A bogey-free round of 68 saw the Englishman finish on 18 under at the Maybank Malaysian Open â€“ seven shots clear of Nicolas Colsaerts, Louis Oosthuizen and Bernd Wiesberger for the largest of his 23 European Tour titles. We hear from Westwood and the trio that finished second as well as from Pablo Larrazabal on being chased by a swarm of hornets. The guys also reflect on Luke Donalds second place on the PGA Tour and Miguel Angel Jimenez debut win on the Champions Tour.

item.title: Golf - European Tour Race to Dubai Show - Episode 15 - Series 6
item.itunes:summary: Robert Lee and Richard Boxall are joined by Bob Bubka to look back at the first major of the year and a second Masters win in three years for Bubba Watson. We hear from the two time champion as well as joint runners up and rookies Jordan Spieth and Jonas Blixt. We also hear from some of the other Europeans who fared well, including Rory McIlroy after his best finish at Augusta, Lee Westwood, Thomas Bjorn and Ian Poulter. Robert and Richard then turn their attention to the next event on The Race to Dubai, The Maybank Malaysian Open, which boasts a field including Masters stars Westwood, Louis Oosthuizen and Francesco Molinari.

item.itunes:summary: Dan Roebuck and Robert Lee reflect on Marco Crespiâ€™s maiden European Tour victory at the NH Collection Open. item.itunes:summary: Dan Roebuck and Robert Lee are joined by American broadcaster Matt Adams to look back at Patrick Reed's impressive win at the WGC-Cadillac Championship at Doral. item.title: Golf - European Tour Race to Dubai Show - Episode 9 - Series 6
item.itunes:summary: This week Robert Lee is joined by John Hawksworth to look back at Ross Fisher's victory at the Tshwane Open in South Africa. The 33-year-old carded a two-under-par 70 to finish on 20 under, three ahead of Northern Ireland's Michael Hoey and South African Danie van Tonder. We hear from both Fisher and Hoey after what proved to be a testing day on the course and Rory McIlroy talks to us about narrowly missing out on his first victory of the year at the Honda Classic in Florida.

item.title: Golf - European Tour Race to Dubai Show - Episode 8 - Series 6
item.itunes:summary: This week Robert Lee is joined by Richard Boxall to look back at Jason Day's thrilling WGC-Accenture Matchplay win over Victor Dubuisson in Arizona. The Frenchman threatened to pull off a truly astounding victory at Dove Mountain before Day finally prevailed on the 23rd hole. American broadcaster Bob Bubka gives us the American perspective on the week's action and we hear from both players. Also, defending champion Dawie Van Der Walt joins the guys to look ahead to this week's Tshwane Open in South Africa.

item.title: Golf - European Tour Race to Dubai Show - Episode 4 - Series 6
item.itunes:summary: Join Robert Lee and John Hawksworth for the latest episode of the European Tour Race to Dubai show. Sergio Garcia beat Mikko Ilonen in a play-off to win the Qatar Masters after both players had finished on 16 under par. We hear from Garcia and Ilonen on their performances in Doha. Garcia had started the final round three shots off the lead, which had been jointly held by England's Steve Webster and Rafael Cabrera-Bello of Spain, reaction from both players is also featured. Plus a look ahead to the third and final event of the desert swing which takes place in Dubai with defending champion Stephen Gallacher.

item.title: Golf - European Tour Race to Dubai Show - 2013 Majors Review
item.itunes:summary: Robert Lee, Ross McFarlane and Bob Bubka take time to reflect on the 2013 Majors and it was a special year that saw three debutant winners and one man picking up his 5th - we hear from Masters Champion Adam Scott after his thrilling playoff win over Angel Cabrera, from Justin Rose on being the first Englishman in 43 years to win the US Open, from US PGA Champion Jason Dufner and from Phil Mickelson after his master-class at Muirfield to claim his first ever Open Championship. The boys also give us their predictions for 2014.

item.itunes:summary: Robert Lee is joined by Ross McFarlane this week as Miguel Angel Jimenez broke his own record as the oldest winner on the European Tour when retaining his Hong Kong Open title. item.title: Golf - European Tour Race to Dubai Show - Episode 43 - Series 5
item.itunes:summary: This week Robert Lee and John Hawksworth look back at a maiden victory for Jin Jeong at the ISPS Handa Perth Invitational. The Korean golfer overcame Ross Fisher from England in a sudden death playoff. We hear from both players as well as from two golfers with very different experiences out in Australia. Peter Lawrie tells us what it meant to keep his card for next year while Peter Hedblom was not so fortunate and now finds himself without a place on Tour next season. We also look ahead of the first of the events making up The Final Series, the BMW Masters in Shanghai and we are live in the Chinese city to see how preparations are coming along to welcome Europeâ€™s top golfers.

item.title: Golf - European Tour Race to Dubai Show - Episode 42 - Series 5
item.itunes:summary: David Lynn is our special guest as Dan Roebuck and Richard Boxall reflect on his first win on Tour for nine years at the Portugal Masters. We also hear from the runner-up Justin Walters whose putt on the last hole secured his playing rights for next year. Frenchman Christian Cevaer tells us what his plans are now he has given up playing on Tour and we are joined by two time winner this year Australiaâ€™s Brett Rumford ahead of the ISPS Handa Perth International, the last event before the season ending series.

item.itunes:summary: Paul McGinley, the European Ryder Cup captain, is our special guest on this weekâ€™s European Tour Race to Dubai show reflecting on a win for Continental Europe at the Seve Trophy. He joins Robert Lee and John Hawksworth as we hear from both captains, the victorious Jose Maria OlazÃ¡bal and Sam Torrance, following the 15-13 win in favour of Europe against Great Britain and Ireland. And we look ahead to this weekâ€™s event, the Portugal Masters with a former winner Spainâ€™s Alvaro Quiros.

item.title: Golf - European Tour Race to Dubai Show - Episode 40 - Series 5
item.itunes:summary: David Howellâ€™s first win in over seven years is the focus of this weekâ€™s European Tour Race to Dubai Show. Dan Roebuck is joined by Robert Lee to look back at a week in Scotland that ended in a playoff win for Howell against the young American golfer Peter Uihlein. We hear from both men as well as from Englandâ€™s Tom Lewis who shot a final round 64 to secure his playing rights for next season. Sir Steve Redgrave, the five time Olympic gold medalist, joins the show to tell us about his week at the home of golf. We look ahead to the next event on the Tour, the Seve Trophy in the company of Paul Lawrie and Gregory Bourdy and with a year to go before the 2014 Ryder Cup weâ€™ll hear from both captains, Tom Watson and Paul McGinley.

item.title: Golf - European Tour Race to Dubai Show - Episode 39 - Series 5
item.itunes:summary: Robert Lee is joined by John Hawksworth this week as they look back at a fantastic win for Julien Quesne at the 70Â° Open dItalia Lindt. We hear exclusively from the Frenchman as well as from joint runners up, David Higgins and Steve Webster. Over in the States it was the season ending and extremely lucrative, Tour Championship and the man who came away with all the money was Henrik Stenson. We hear from the popular Swede and exclusively from his coach Pete Cowan. Next up on The Race to Dubai is the Alfred Dunhill Links at St Andrews and former winner Simon Dyson helps preview what is an exciting week on the tour.

item.title: Golf - European Tour Race to Dubai Show - Episode 37 - Series 5
item.itunes:summary: Robert Lee is this week joined by John Hawksworth and they look back at a 14th win on the European Tour for Thomas Bjorn after his playoff win at the Omega European Open. We hear from the Dane as well as from Scotsman Craig Lee who was edged out in that play off, plus third placed Victor Dubuisson who returned to form in Switzerland. We also hear exclusively from Gordon Brand Jnr after he won his second Senior Tour event at the Winstongolf Senior Open in Germany. Next up on The Race to Dubai is the KLM Dutch Open and former winner Ross Fisher and local star Joost Luiten help preview the week at Kennemer Golf and Country Club.

item.title: Golf - European Tour Race to Dubai Show - Episode 36 - Series 5
item.itunes:summary: Robert Lee is this week joined by Richard Boxall, who both speak exclusively with Frenchman Gregory Bourdy after his first win on the European Tour in 4 years at the ISPS Handa Wales Open at Celtic Manor. We also hear from American Golfer Peter Uihlein who nearly forced Bourdy to a play off, plus from the Dane Soren Kjeldsen and Ryder Cup captain Paul McGinley of Ireland. Ken Brown pays tribute to the late Dave Thomas and in previewing the next European Tour event, the Omega European Masters, last yearâ€™s winner Richie Ramsey tells us why heâ€™s looking forward to playing at Crans sur Sierre once again. All that plus an unusual tip of the week from another Dane, Andreas Harto.

item.title: Golf - European Tour Race to Dubai Show - Episode 35 - Series 5
item.itunes:summary: This week Robert Lee is joined by John Hawksworth as they look back at a maiden Tour win for Englands Tommy Fleetwood at the Johnnie Walker Championship at Gleneagles. We hear more from Fleetwood as well as the two players he beat in the play off Ricardo Gonzalez of Argentina and Scotlands Stephen Gallacher. On the PGA Tour The Masters Champion Adam Scott won The Barclays, the first of the Fedex Cup tournaments and we hear from the new World Number Two. We also preview two events this week the ISPS Handa Wales Open at Celtic Manor and the Northern Ireland Open Challenge with five time winner on tour Michael Hoey telling us why he is playing at this home event rather than in Wales.

item.title: Golf - European Tour Race to Dubai Show - Episode 33 - Series 5
item.itunes:summary: This week Robert Lee and Ross McFarlane look back at the last of the Majors this year, the PGA Championship at Oak Hill and a brilliant win for Jason Dufner, his maiden Major win. We hear more from the new Champion Dufner, from runner up Jim Furyk who had led overnight and from Swede Henrik Stenson who had yet another fantastic week. American broadcaster Bob Bubka joins the show to help reflect on all the stories from Oak Hill and we hear from the defending Champion Rory McIlroy who was encouraged by his play this week.

item.title: Golf - European Tour Race to Dubai Show - Episode 32 - Series 5
item.itunes:summary: This week Dan Roebuck and Robert Lee look back at the latest of the WGC events, the Bridgestone Invitational at Firestone and a brilliant 7 shot win for the World Number One Tiger Woods. We hear from Woods after his dominant display at Firestone including a second round 61. We look ahead to the last Major of the year, the PGA Championship, in the company of American broadcaster Bob Bubka. The Open Champion Phil Mickelson tells us a bit about the course while defending Champion Rory McIlroy admits he isnâ€™t too far from getting back to his best.

item.title: Golf - European Tour Race to Dubai Show - Episode 31 - Series 5
item.itunes:summary: Dan Roebuck and Ross McFarlane look back at two events in this weeks show. First the most extraordinary end to the Senior Open Championship at Birkdale. It was darkness when the play off started between Bernard Langer and Mark Wiebe. Eventually they had to finish it off the next day with Mark Wiebe coming out on top. We hear from the new Champion and from Bernard Langer who had double bogeyed the last to take it into a play-off. The Race to Dubai travelled to Moscow last week for the M2M Russian Open won by Michael Hoey. It was his fifth win on Tour and we talk exclusively to the Northern Irishman. We also look ahead to the WGC Bridgestone Invitational at Firestone as Phil Mickelson makes his first competitive appearance since winning The Open Championship at Muirfield.

item.title: Golf - European Tour Race to Dubai Show - Episode 30 - Series 5
item.itunes:summary: Robert Lee and Richard Boxall are joined by Ross McFarlane to pay homage to Phil Mickelson for his impressive Open Championship victory at Muirfield. Weâ€™ve reaction from the now 4 time Major Champion, from runner up Henrik Stenson of Sweden and from the Englishmen who finished tied in 3rd place Lee Westwood and Ian Poulter. Their compatriot Matthew Fitzpatrick also features after he finished as the highest amateur on the Open leaderboard, as does the Worldâ€™s number 2 Rory McIlroy, who missed another cut. Robert and co. also look ahead to this weekâ€™s M2M Russian Open as well as the Senior Open Championship presented by Rolex, taking place at Royal Birkdale.

item.title: Golf - European Tour Race to Dubai Show - Episode 29 - Series 5
item.itunes:summary: Robert Lee and Richard Boxall dissect a first ever victory for Phil Mickelson on British soil at the Aberdeen Asset Management Scottish Open. Weâ€™ve reaction from the 3 time Major Champion to that win at Castle Stuart and from Branden Grace of South Africa who was beaten by the American in a play-off decider. We also hear from JB Hansen who finished tied in 3rd place despite shooting a 9 on hole 2 in his final round, from Englishman John Parry who ended tied in 5th place and from Ernie Els, who missed the cut. Plus, while previewing this weekâ€™s 142nd Open Championship, Rob and John speak exclusively to Thomas Levet of France, who shares his memories of competing against eventual Champion Els in a play off when The Open was last held at Muirfield in 2002.

item.title: Golf - European Tour Race to Dubai Show - Episode 28 - Series 5
item.itunes:summary: Robert Lee and John Hawksworth reflect on another European Tour victory for Graeme McDowell at the Alstom Open de France. Weâ€™ve reaction from the Irishman to that victory and from Richard Sterne of South Africa who finished 2nd and from Englishman Graeme Storm who finished tied for 3rd. Plus, reigning Aberdeen Asset Management Scottish Open Champion Jeev Milkha Singh speaks exclusively to Rob and John about what makes the Castle Stuart Links course so special, defending his title and how his determination to play there is making him miss the premiere of a film which has been made about his father and former Olympic athlete Milkha Singh.

item.title: Golf - European Tour Race to Dubai Show - Episode 27 - Series 5
item.itunes:summary: Robert Lee and John Hawksworth reflect on a long overdue win for Paul Casey at the Irish Open. Weâ€™ve reaction from the Englishman to that victory and from those that tied for 2nd place; Robert Rock also of England and from Dutchman Joost Luiten. We also hear from Rory McIlroy who for the 3rd time this year on the European Tour, failed to make the cut in County Kildare. Plus former Golfer and now its Championship Director Jean van der Velde helps us preview the Alstom Open de France, which is the next event on the Race to Dubai, and gives us an insight into what changes might be made to Le Golf National course in Versailles ahead of it staging the 2018 Ryder Cup.

item.itunes:summary: Robert Lee and John Hawksworth reflect on an impressive win for Ernie Els at the BMW Invitational Open. item.title: Golf - European Tour Race to Dubai Show - Episode 25 - Series 5
item.itunes:summary: Dan Roebuck, Richard Boxall and Bob Bubka look back on a magnificent maiden major triumph for Justin Rose at the US Open. We hear from the first English major winner for 17 years, as well as from a heart-broken Phil Mickelson who finished runner up at the event for an incredible 6th time. We also hear from the worldâ€™s number one and two Tiger Woods and Rory McIlroy who struggled on a tough Merion course. We speak exclusively to Simon Thornton who won his first European Tour title at the Najeti Hotels et Golfs Open at St Omer. Plus former champion Pablo Larrazabal helps us look ahead to the next event on the Race to Dubai, the BMW International Open in Munich.
item.description: Dan Roebuck, Richard Boxall and Bob Bubka look back on a magnificent maiden major triumph for Justin Rose at the US Open. We hear from the first English major winner for 17 years, as well as from a heart-broken Phil Mickelson who finished runner up at the event for an incredible 6th time. We also hear from the worldâ€™s number one and two Tiger Woods and Rory McIlroy who struggled on a tough Merion course. We speak exclusively to Simon Thornton who won his first European Tour title at the Najeti Hotels et Golfs Open at St Omer. Plus former champion Pablo Larrazabal helps us look ahead to the next event on the Race to Dubai, the BMW International Open in Munich.

item.itunes:summary: Dan Roebuck and John Hawksworth look back at a second European Tour win for Joost Luiten at the Lyoness Open in Austria. We hear from the Dutchman as well as from Thomas Bjorn who finished in second place two shots behind. item.title: Golf - European Tour Race to Dubai Show - Episode 23 - Series 5
item.itunes:summary: Nordea Masters Champion Mikko Ilonen joins Robert Lee and Kim Thomas to discuss his win in Sweden, his first for almost 6 years. We also hear from runner up and local favourite Jonas Blixt and from forth placed Matteo Manaserro who continued his good recent form. Also joining the show this week is Australian Andrew Dodt who became the first man in European Tour history to card two holes in one in a single round. Plus we look ahead to the next event on the Race to Dubai, The Lyoness Open in Austria with the help of defending champion Bernd Wiesberger.

item.title: Golf - European Tour Race to Dubai Show - Episode 22 - Series 5
item.itunes:summary: BMW PGA Championship winner Matteo Manassero joins Dan Roebuck and Robert Lee to look back on his historic win at Wentworth. The Italian saw off Simon Khan and Marc Warren in a three way playoff to become the youngest winner of the event at the age of just 20. We hear from Khan and Warren as well as from Rory McIlroy who had a week to forget after missing the cut. We also hear from Europes Ryder Cup captain Paul McGinley after it was announced he would have three wild card picks ahead of next yearâ€™s event at Gleneagles. Plus we look ahead to the Nordea Masters in Sweden and the Memorial Tournament in the United States.

item.title: Golf - European Tour Race to Dubai Show - Episode 21 - Series 5
item.itunes:summary: This week Dan Roebuck and John Hawksworth look back at Graeme McDowells win at the Volvo World MatchPlay Championship in Bulgaria. The Northern Irishman beat Thailands Thongchai Jaidee in the final. We hear from both players and from a disappointed Ian Poulter. We also talk to the winner of the second event on Tour last week, Peter Uihlein who recorded his maiden win at the Madeira Islands Open. And we speak exclusively to the World Number 6 Luke Donald who is going for an historic hat trick of victories at the BMW PGA Championship at Wentworth later this week.

item.title: Golf - European Tour Race to Dubai Show - Episode 20 - Series 5
item.itunes:summary: With no event on The Race to Dubai last week, Richard Kaufman and Richard Boxall look back at The Players Championship on the PGA Tour, which was won by world number one Tiger Woods. We hear from the four time winner this year Tiger Woods and also from Sergio Garcia who saw his hopes for victory fade dramatically at the notorious 17th hole at Sawgrass. The Race to Dubai return this week with two events, the Volvo World Match Play hosted by the Thracian Cliff Golf and Beach resort in Bulgaria for the first time and The Madeira Islands Open. And our tip of the Week comes from the exciting young German talent Moritz Lampert.

item.title: Golf - European Tour Race to Dubai Show - Episode 19 - Series 5
item.itunes:summary: On this weeks show Robert Lee and John Hawksworth look back at another fantastic win for Brett Rumford at the Volvo China Open, his second successive victory on Tour. We hear from the Australian who has now moved to the top of the Race to Dubai. We also hear from Finlandâ€™s Mikko Ilonen who finished in second place after equaling the course record in the second round and from Victor Dubuisson whose girlfriend was his caddy this week. We also take a look at the growth of the sport in China after Ye Wo-cheng made history by qualifying for the event at the age of just 12 years old. And we preview the big event in world golf next week The Players Championship in Sawgrass.

item.title: Golf - European Tour Race to Dubai Show - Episode 18 - Series 5
item.itunes:summary: This week Robert Lee is joined by the latest winner on the Race to Dubai, Brett Rumford who secured his fourth European Tour title with a play off win at the Ballantine's Championship. We speak exclusively to the Australian after his first win in almost 5 years and also hear from the two players who lost in that play off, fellow Australian Marcus Fraser and Scotland's Peter Whiteford. We are live in Tianjin ahead of the Volvo China Open with our reporter Nick Dye and our tip of the week comes from Dutch player Robert Jan Derksen.

item.title: Golf - European Tour Race to Dubai Show - Episode 17 - Series 5
item.itunes:summary: This week Robert Lee is joined by John Hawksworth as the Race to Dubai finally made it back to Europe with the Open de Espana and a win for RaphaÃ«l Jacquelin after a record equalling nine hole play off. We hear from all three golfers who took part in the thrilling climax, Jacquelin, Felipe Aguilar and Maximilian Kieffer. We also hear from Miguel Angel Jimenez who returned to golf this week after recovering from the broken leg he sustained during a winter skiing accident. In a Spanish themed week, Gonzalo Fernandez Castano tells us all about his experiences when playing with Tiger Woods at the Masters. And we hear from the latest European winner on the PGA Tour in the States, Graeme McDowell.

item.title: Golf - European Tour Race to Dubai Show - Episode 16 - Series 5
item.itunes:summary: This week Robert Lee is joined by Richard Boxall and they review all the action and talking points from the first Major of the year as Adam Scott took the honours becoming the first Australian ever to win the Masters. We hear from an ecstatic Scott and from Argentinaâ€™s Angel Cabrera who he beat at the second play off hole after a quite sensational end to the final round. The World Number One Tiger Woods tells us why he did not contemplate pulling out despite making the headlines on Friday for all the wrong reasons and we hear from a number of Europeans after their Masters week including debutante Thorbjorn Olesen who finished in a tie for 6th, Rory McIlroy and Lee Westwood.

item.title: Golf - European Tour Race to Dubai Show - Episode 15 - Series 5
item.itunes:summary: Robert Lee is joined by Richard Boxall to look ahead to the first Major of the year, The Masters at Augusta National. During the show we hear from the defending champion Bubba Watson, from World Numbers One and Two, Tiger Woods and Rory McIlroy and from Italy's Matteo Manassero who is playing in his second Masters at the age of 19. We get some first hand insight into how to play the course from David Howell who has competed at The Masters three times and US broadcaster Bob Bubka tells us why he thinks its impossible to look beyond Tiger Woods.

item.title: Golf - European Tour Race to Dubai Show - Episode 14 - Series 5
item.itunes:summary: Robert Lee is joined by Ross McFarlane to reflect on the Trophy Hassan II in Morocco. We hear from the winner, Marcel Siem of Germany as his three shot victory took him so near yet so far to win a place at Augusta at The Masters. We also hear from Mikko Ilonen and David Horsey who tied for second. Richie Ramsey joins us to explain the uniqueness of The Masters and what makes it so special for both spectators and players as the tournament draws closer. Also, following his win last week at Bay Hill, Tiger Woods tells of his delight at returning to the top of the world rankings after 29 months.

item.title: Golf - European Tour Race to Dubai Show - Episode 13 - Series 5
item.itunes:summary: Robert Lee is joined by Ewen Murray at a weather affected maiden win for Thailandâ€™s Kiradech Aphibarnrat at The Maybank Malaysian Open. We hear from the 23 year old Thai, as well as from second placed Edoardo Molinari as he returns to form after injury and from former Masters Champion Charl Schwartzel. We also hear from world number three Luke Donald after missing his first ever cut on the regular European Tour. We look ahead to the next event of the Race to Dubai, The Trophee Hassan II in Morocco with the help of three time winner on tour Gregory Havret.

item.title: Golf - European Tour Race to Dubai Show - Episode 12 - Series 5
item.itunes:summary: This week Robert Lee is joined by John Hawksworth to look back at another South African winner on The Race to Dubai as Thomas Aiken took the Avantha Masters in India. We hear from the two time winner on tour as well as from local hero Gaganjeet Bhullar who finished three shots behind in second place. We are also joined by local journalist Krishnaswamy who speak about the development of golf in India. European Tour golfer of the month for January, Chris Wood joins the show to help look ahead to The Maybank Malaysian Open in Kuala Lumpur and to reflect on his start to the season.

item.title: Golf - European Tour Race to Dubai Show - Episode 11 - Series 5
item.itunes:summary: This week Robert Lee is joined by Richard Boxall to look back at a win for Tiger Woods at the second of the WGC events this season, the Cadillac Championship. It was the 17th WGC title of Woods's career. Graeme McDowell was the leading European finishing in 3rd place but it was his compatriot and World Number One Rory McIlroy who made the headlines ending a tough week with a 65. We hear from both the Northern Irish golfers and from Phil Mickelson who also finished in 3rd place. And two time former winner SSP Chowrasia helps us look ahead to this weekâ€™s event, the Avantha Masters in India.

item.itunes:summary: Dawie Van Der Walt, the latest winner on the European Tour, joins Robert Lee and John Hawksworth to talk about his maiden win at the Tshwane Open. item.title: Golf - European Tour Race to Dubai Show - Episode 9 - Series 5
item.itunes:summary: On this weeks show Richard Kaufman is joined by Richard Boxall as they reflect on the first big event of this year, the WGC Accenture Match Play Championship won by Matt Kuchar. Kuchar beat defending champion Hunter Mahan in the final and we hear more from both golfers. The weather made all the headlines on day one as heavy snow caused the suspension of play but when it resumed on day two, there were plenty of shocks in store including a win for Shane Lowry over fellow Irishman and World Number One Rory McIlroy as well as Tiger Woods defeat at the first hurdle to Charles Howell III. We round up all the stories of the week in the company of US broadcaster Matt Adams, plus we look ahead at the next event on the Race to Dubai, The Tshwane Open in Centurion, South Africa, a new event on the Tour schedule for 2013 and local boy and recent winner on tour, Darren Fichardt tells us a little about the course. Our tip of the week comes from Rafael Cabrera Bello.

item.itunes:summary: This week Robert Lee and Ross McFarlane look back at Richard Sterne after his remarkable win at the Joburg Open, his first win after two years out of the game through injury. We hear exclusively from Sterne after his 7 shot victory which qualifies him for the WGC Accenture World Match Play in Arizona. We also hear from European Tour Radio News Reporter Nick Dye to reflect on the start of the 2013 Race to Dubai season and our tip of the week come from Argentine Tano Goya.

item.title: Golf - European Tour Race to Dubai Show - Episode 6 - Series 5
item.itunes:summary: This week Robert Lee and John Hawksworth congratulate Stephen Gallagher as he ends a nine-year wait for a second European Tour title with victory at the Omega Dubai Desert Classic. We also hear from Richard Sterne who came second and from Lee Westwood who finished in a tie for 5th in his opening event of 2013. We talk to Mike Green from the Sunshine Tour about yet another Tour event this week in South Africa, The Joburg Open and ask why they are producing so many world class players and we speak exclusively to Thomas Levet after he became the latest European Tour player to rack up 500 events.

item.title: Golf - European Tour Race to Dubai Show - Episode 5 - Series 5
item.itunes:summary: This week Robert Lee and John Hawksworth discuss Chris Wood's maiden Tour win at the Qatar Commercial Bank Masters. We also get the view of a man who has know Wood since he was a child on how far he can now go in the game. Sergio Garcia tells us why his second place was a positive start to the season and we go live to the course ahead of the next event, The Omega Dubai Desert Classic. Paul Casey has a tip for all amateur golfers on how to play in the wind while Ignacio Garrido joins us the week he made his 500th European Tour appearance.

item.title: Golf - European Tour Race to Dubai Show - Episode 4 - Series 5
item.itunes:summary: This week Ross McFarlane joins Robert Lee as they a look back at Jamie Donaldsons win at the Abu Dhabi HSBC Golf Championship, his second Tour title. We also hear from Justin Rose who had led for most of the week and from World Number One Rory McIlroy who missed the cut. We stay in the Middle East to preview the next event the Commercialbank Qatar Masters and we get all the reaction to the news of Paul McGinleys appointment as Captain of the European Ryder Cup team for 2014, as well as hear from the man himself.
item.description: This week Ross McFarlane joins Robert Lee as they a look back at Jamie Donaldsons win at the Abu Dhabi HSBC Golf Championship, his second Tour title. We also hear from Justin Rose who had led for most of the week and from World Number One Rory McIlroy who missed the cut. We stay in the Middle East to preview the next event the Commercialbank Qatar Masters and we get all the reaction to the news of Paul McGinleys appointment as Captain of the European Ryder Cup team for 2014, as well as hear from the man himself.

item.title: Golf - European Tour Race to Dubai Show - Episode 3 - Series 5
item.itunes:summary: This week Robert Lee and Richard Boxall reflect on yet another victory for Louis Oosthuizen after the South Africans win at the Volvo Golf Champions. Scott Jamieson finished second after letting a five shot lead slip, he tells us how nerves played a factor. We also look ahead to the first of the Gulf Swing events with the heavily anticipated Abu Dhabi HSBC Golf Championship. Henrik Stenson joins us from the course to help look ahead to the week and tells us his hopes for the season. And Robert Rock reminisces over the title he won in spectacular style last year beating Rory McIlroy and Tiger Woods in the final round.

item.title: Golf - European Tour Race to Dubai Show - Episode 2 - Series 5
item.itunes:summary: This week Robert Lee and Richard Boxall look ahead to the first event of 2013 and the latest event on the Race to Dubai, The Volvo Golf Champions. Joining the show this week is South African journalist Neil Bisseker to add some local knowledge of the Durban Country Club and also to talk about the strength of South African golf on the European Tour. Our tip of the week comes from Englishman Andy Sullivan and we bring you all the latest news from around the world of golf.

item.title: Golf - European Tour Race to Dubai Show - 2012 Ryder Cup Review
item.itunes:summary: In a very special edition of the European Tour Race to Dubai Show, Robert Lee and John Hawksworth look back at a thrilling week of golf in Medinah as Europe staged the comeback of all time to win the Ryder Cup. Reflecting on a very special week for the European Tour, we hear from some of the heroes of the week including Ian Poulter, Martin Kaymer and the victorious captain Jose Maria OlazÃ¡bal. And we get an American perspective on the week from legendary golf broadcaster Bob Bubka.

item.title: Golf - European Tour Race to Dubai Show - 2012 Majors Review
item.itunes:summary: Dan Roebuck and John Hawksworth take time to reflect on the 2012 Majors and it was another triumphant year as two of the four ended up in the hands of European Tour members. We hear from Masters Champion Bubba Watson after his play-off win over Louis Oosthuizen, from Webb Simpson after his maiden Major triumph at the US Open, Ernie Els after his surprise Open victory at Lytham and from Rory McIlroy, who simply blew the field away at the final major of the year, the US PGA Championship.

item.title: Golf - European Tour Race to Dubai Show - Episode 51 - Series 4
item.itunes:summary: This week Dan Roebuck and John Hawksworth look back at The Alfred Dunhill Championship at Leopard Creek and a remarkable 12 shot victory for local star Charl Schwartzel. We hear from the inform South African and also from Sergio Garcia after his win in Malaysia after a final round 61 in a weather affected tournament. We also hear from Tom Watson following his appointment as the new US Ryder Cup Captain and get reaction from US Broadcaster Matt Adams looking ahead the Glenaegles in 2014.

item.title: Golf - European Tour Race to Dubai Show - Episode 50 - Series 4
item.itunes:summary: This week Robert Lee and John Hawksworth look back at a rain drenched South Africa and a win for Scott Jamieson at the Nelson Mandela Championship. We hear more from Jamieson after his maiden win on tour and also from Charl Schwartzel after his victory at the Thailand Golf Championship and Peter Senior who at 53 became the oldest winner of the Australian Open. The Race to Dubai stays in South Africa this week and former winner Richard Sterne helps us look ahead to The Alfred Dunhill Championship at Leopards Creek.

item.title: Golf - European Tour Race to Dubai Show - Episode 49 - Series 4
item.itunes:summary: On this weeks European Tour Race to Dubai show, Robert Lee and John Hawksworth discuss the climax of the Tour School Finals with 28 golfers securing their membership for 2013. Also featured are Martin Kaymer after his win at the Nedbank Golf Challenge in South Africa and Graeme McDowell after his win at The World Challenge in California. We hear for R&A Chief Executive and Tiger Woods on the recent rule change involving belly putters and also look ahead to the first event on the Race to Dubai 2013 calendar, the Nelson Mandela Championship in South Africa. Our tip of the week comes from Alex Noren.

item.title: Golf - European Tour Race to Dubai Show - Episode 48 - Series 4
item.itunes:summary: This week Robert Lee and Ross McFarlane look back at a thrilling end to the Race to Dubai as World Number One Rory McIlroy finished the year in style by winning the DP World Tour Championship. We hear more from the undisputed golfer of the year, from World Number Two Luke Donald who had a share of the lead going into Sunday and from runner up Justin Rose who shot a course record 62 in the final round. We also look ahead to the 2013 Race to Dubai schedule and round up some of the highlights of the year. Our tip of the week comes from Richard Finch, the final man to qualify for last weeks event in Dubai.

item.title: Golf - European Tour Race to Dubai Show - Episode 47 - Series 4
item.itunes:summary: This week Robert Lee and John Hawksworth look back at an historic win for Miguel Angel Jiminez at the UBS Hong Kong Open as he becomes the oldest winner on The European Tour. We hear from the Spaniard and from Henrik Stenson who ended a five year run without a win as he secured the second event on Tour this week, the SA Open Championship. It was a busy week of golf all over the world as Luke Donald won in Japan and Adam Scott took the Australian Masters. This week sees the final event of the season, the DP World Tour Championship, and although Rory McIlroy has wrapped up the Race to Dubai there is still plenty to play for and our tip of the week comes from Richard Green.

item.title: Golf - European Tour Race to Dubai Show - Episode 46 - Series 4
item.itunes:summary: This week Robert Lee and John Hawksworth look back at a Matteo Manaserros playoff victory at the Barclays Singapore Open. We hear from the teenager after his third win on tour. We also hear from runner up, Louis Oosthuizen as well as Rory McIlroy, who by finishing third cemented his position as Europeâ€™s number one as he can no longer be caught in the 2012 Race to Dubai. This week on the Race to Dubai there are two events, the UBS Hong Kong Open and the South African Open Championship. Defending champions, Rory McIlroy and Hennie Otto help us look ahead at the respective tournaments. Our tip of the week comes from Ryder Cup hero, Francesco Molinari.

item.title: Golf - European Tour Race to Dubai Show - Episode 45 - Series 4
item.itunes:summary: This week Richard Kaufman and Robert Lee look back at a stunning win for Ian Poulter at the WGC HSBC Champions at Mission Hills Golf Club. We hear from Poulter as well from runners up Ernie Els and Phil Mickleson who were two shots back. Next up on the Race to Dubai is the Barclays Singapore Open and three time winner, Adam Scott helps us look ahead to that. Our tip of the week comes from Ryder Cup hero, Justin Rose.

item.title: Golf - European Tour Race to Dubai Show - Episode 44 - Series 4
item.itunes:summary: This week Robert Lee and Ross McFarlane look back at Peter Hansons impressive win at the BMW Masters in Shanghai. We hear from Hanson as well from runner up Rory McIlroy who pushed the Dane all the way. Ryder Cup stars, Luke Donald and Ian Poulter who finished 3rd and 4th respectively in China are also in this weeks show. Next up on the Race to Dubai is the WGC HSBC Champions from Mission Hills and another Ryder Cup hero and defending Champion Martin Kaymer helps us look ahead to that.

item.itunes:summary: This week Robert Lee and Ross McFarlane look back at Bo Van Pelts win at The Perth International. We hear from Van Pelt and from runner up and fellow countryman Jason Dufner. With the end of the golfing year coming ever closer, we look ahead to the next event, a star studded BMW Masters in Shanghai with the help of multiple Major Champion, Padraig Harrington and our tip of the week comes from Englishman Anthony Wall.

item.title: Golf - European Tour Race to Dubai Show - Episode 37 - Series 4
item.itunes:summary: This week Dan Roebuck and Kim Thomas look back a dramatic win for Swedens Peter Hanson at the KLM Open in Holland. We hear from Ryder Cup bound Hanson, from runner up Ritchie Ramsey who nearly made it two wins in row and also from fellow runner up Pablo Larrazabal. One man who did make it two wins from two was Northern Irishman Rory McIlroy, who held off a very strong field at the BMW Championship on the PGA Tour, we hear from the world number one. This week the European Tour moves to Turin for the Italian Open, and local hero Matteo Manessero helps us look ahead to events in Northern Italy and our tip of the week comes from former Open Champion Todd Hamilton.

This week the tour moves to the Netherlands for the KLM Open and the defending champion Simon Dyson tells us what to expect from the course and our tip of the week comes from South Africas Darren Fichardt.

item.title: Golf - European Tour Race to Dubai Show - Episode 34 - Series 4
item.itunes:summary: This week Robert Lee is joined by Richard Boxall to look ahead to the next event on the Race to Dubai, the Johnnie Walker Championship, the last counting event in the race for European Ryder Cup points. We hear from European Captain Jose Maria Olazabal, as well from Davis Love III who will take charge of the US team in Chicago and from some of the contenders for the 4 US Wild Card picks. We are joined by US Broadcaster Matt Adams to look in more detail at the US team and our tip of the week comes from Australian David Merriman.

item.title: Golf - European Tour Race to Dubai Show - Episode 33 - Series 4
item.itunes:summary: This week Robert Lee is joined by Richard Boxall to look back at the action from the final Major of the year, the US PGA Championship and a remarkable 8 shot victory by Northern Irelands Rory McIlroy. We hear from McIlroy as well as from runner up and relative unknown Englishman, David Lynn. We hear the thoughts of Justin Rose and Ian Poulter who tried in vain to close the gap on McIlroy on the final day and were joined by American broadcaster Bob Bubka for his thoughts on events at Kiawah Island.

item.itunes:summary: This week Robert Lee is joined by Ross McFarlane and Paul Eales to review a stunning 141st Open Championship in a European Tour Podcast Special. item.itunes:summary: Robert Lee and Richard Boxall look back on Marcel Siems 2nd European Tour title at the Alstom Open de France, we hear from the German as well as from runner up Francesco Molinari and home favourite Raphael Jacquelin who finished in 3rd place. Scott Jamieson helps us preview the next event on the Race to Dubai, the Aberdeen Asset Management Scottish Open at Castle Stuart. And continuing the Scottish theme our Tip of the Week comes from former Open Champion Paul Lawrie.

Scott Jamieson helps us preview the next event on the Race to Dubai, the Aberdeen Asset Management Scottish Open at Castle Stuart. And continuing the Scottish theme our Tip of the Week comes from former Open Champion Paul Lawrie.

item.title: Golf - European Tour Race to Dubai Show - Episode 27 - Series 4
item.itunes:summary: Robert Lee presents the latest episode of the European Tour Race to Dubai Show as Jamie Donaldson wins The Irish Open at Royal Portrush to record his maiden victory in his 255th European Tour event. We hear from the Welshman, as well as from Anthony Wall who finished in joint second place. Ross McFarlane joins Robert to look ahead to the next event on the Race to Dubai, the French Open and we hear from the defending champion Thomas Levet.

We hear from the young Englishman and from the Australian runner up. We also look ahead to the next event on the Race to Dubai, the Irish Open and we hear from the defending champion Simon Dyson and from Paul Lawrie.

item.title: Golf - European Tour Race to Dubai Show - Episode 25 - Series 4
item.itunes:summary: Dan Roebuck and John Hawksworth reflect on a maiden major triumph for Webb Simpson at the US Open in San Francisco. We hear from the young American, as well as from runner up Graeme McDowell and Padraig Harrington who returned to form to finish tied 4th. We also hear from Tiger Woods who fell away over the weekend after leading at half way. US broadcaster Bob Bubka joins us to look back on how things unfolded at The Olympic Club. Plus we round up the weeks other golf news and look ahead to the next event on the Race to Dubai, the BMW International Open in Cologne.

item.title: Golf - European Tour Race to Dubai Show - Episode 24 - Series 4
item.itunes:summary: This week Richard Kaufman is joined by John Hawksworth as they look back at Lee Westwoods emphatic 5 stroke win at the Nordea Masters, we hear from the world number three who feels his game is in perfect shape ahead of the US Open, as well as from Ross Fisher who finished in second place. We are joined on the phone by US broadcaster Bob Bubka to look ahead to the second major of the year, the US Open, which gets underway at The Olympic Club in San Francisco later this week. We hear from the defending Champion Rory McIlroy and excited debutant Lee Slattery.

item.itunes:summary: This week Robert Lee is joined by Richard Boxall as they look back at Thongchai Jaidees fifth Tour win and his first on European soil at the Wales Open. item.title: Golf - European Tour Race to Dubai Show - Episode 22 - Series 4
item.itunes:summary: This week Robert Lee is joined by Richard Boxall as they look back at Luke Donalds successful defence at the BMW PGA Championship at Wentworth which saw him regain his World Number One spot. We hear from Donald, from Justin Rose and from a disappointed Rory McIlroy who missed the cut. The European Ryder Cup Captain Jose Maria Olazabal helps us preview the next event on the Race the Dubai, the Wales Open where he is making his debut and our tip of the week is about playing in the wind and comes from Tommy Fleetwood.

item.title: Golf - European Tour Race to Dubai Show - Episode 21 - Series 4
item.itunes:summary: This week Robert Lee and John Hawksworth look back at the Volvo World Match Play Championship in Spain where Belgian Nicolas Colsaerts beat Graeme McDowell in the final to capture only the second European Tour title of his career, we hear from both finalists as well as from losing semi finalist Paul Lawrie. We hear from Englishman Justin Rose ahead of the next event on the Race the Dubai. the Tours flagship event at Wentworth, the BMW PGA Championship. Plus we look ahead to the US Senior PGA Championship at Benton Harbour in Michigan.

item.title: Golf - European Tour Race to Dubai Show - Episode 20 - Series 4
item.itunes:summary: This week Robert Lee and Ross McFarlane look back at a maiden tour victory for Portugals Ricardo Santos following a stunning final round of 63 to win the Madeira Islands Open. Matt Kuchar won The Players Championship in Sawgrass, we hear from him and from Luke Donald who finished in 6th place but it was a missed cut for the World Number One Rory McIlroy. We hear from defending Champion Ian Poulter ahead of the Volvo World Match Play in Spain and our tip of the week comes from Northern Irishman Gareth Maybin.

item.title: Golf - European Tour Race to Dubai Show - Episode 19 - Series 4
item.itunes:summary: This week Robert Lee and John Hawksworth look back at a third European Tour win for Francesco Molinari at the Open de Espana. We hear from the new Champion and from two of the players who finished in a tie for second place, Pablo Larrazabal and Denmark's Soren Kjeldsen. Rory McIlroy regained top spot in the world rankings after finishing runner up to first time winner on the PGA Tour - Rickie Fowler. We hear from a former Champion Bradley Dredge ahead of the Madeira Islands Open this week and our tip of the week comes from James Morrison.

item.title: Golf - European Tour Race to Dubai Show - Episode 18 - Series 4
item.itunes:summary: This week Robert Lee and Ross McFarlane look back at as Bernd Wiesberger wins The Ballantines Championship In South Korea to record his maiden Tour victory. We hear from the Austrian, from Richie Ramsay who finished in second place after a final round of 65 and from Victor Dubuisson who had another good week. We look ahead to the next event on the Race the Dubai as the players move to mainland Europe for the Open de Espana and we hear from home favourite Rafael Cabrera Bello, while our tip of the week comes from World Number 13 Adam Scott.

item.title: Golf - European Tour Race to Dubai Show - Episode 16 - Series 4
item.itunes:summary: This week Robert Lee and John Hawksworth look back at the Maybank Malaysian Open as Louis Oosthuizen puts his Masters disappointment behind him with a three shot victory. We hear from the South African and from Scotlands Stephen Gallacher who finished in second place despite signing for an incorrect score at the end of his third round. We look ahead to the next event on the Race to Dubai the Volvo Open in the company of defending champion Nicolas Colsaerts and our tip of the week comes from our very own John Hawksworth.

item.title: Golf - European Tour Race to Dubai Show - Episode 15 - Series 4
item.itunes:summary: This week Robert Lee and Ross McFarlane look back at the first Major of the Year and a sensational playoff victory for Bubba Watson at Augusta to win the Masters to become the latest owner of the coveted Green Jacket. We hear from the new Champion, from Louis Oosthuizen who went so close and from Tiger Woods and Rory McIlroy who never found themselves in contention. We are joined by US Broadcaster Bob Bubka who had a ring side seat for everything that unfolded in Augusta and then we look ahead to the next event on the Race to Dubai, the Maybank Malaysian Open.

item.title: Golf - European Tour Race to Dubai Show - Episode 14 - Series 4
item.itunes:summary: This week Dan Roebuck and Robert Lee reflect on another maiden win on Tour this season as Denmarks Thorbjorn Olesen wins the Sicilian Open. We hear from the new Champion as he held off a brave challenge from Englands Chris Wood who shot a course record equaling 64 on the final day. We hear from Hunter Mahan who rose to Number Four in the world after victory in the Houston Open and we bring you a full preview of the first Major of the season, the Masters. World Number 3 Lee Westwood and former Masters Champion Phil Mickelson are among those who help us look ahead to a week at Augusta. And our tip of the week comes from Swedens Christian Nilsson.

item.title: Golf - European Tour Race to Dubai Show - Episode 13 - Series 4
item.itunes:summary: This week Robert Lee and Ewan Murray reflect on successive rounds of 65 which helped Northern Irishman Michael Hoey lift the Trophee Hassan II in Morocco. We hear from the Champion and from runner up Damien McGrane who led going into the final day, as well as a disappointed Matteo Manassero who just missed out on a place at The Masters after failing to win in Morocco. We hear from Tiger Woods after his victory at The Arnold Palmer Invitational at Bay Hill, his first win on the PGA Tour for 30 months. Defending Champion Raphael Jacquelin helps us look ahead to the next event on the Race the Dubai, the Sicilian Open and our tip of the week comes from Englands Robert Coles.

item.title: Golf - European Tour Race to Dubai Show - Episode 10 - Series 4
item.itunes:summary: This week Robert Lee and John Hawksworth pay tribute to Rory McIlroy as he becomes the second youngest World Number One golfer after his win in the States at The Honda Classic. We hear from the 22 year old Northern Irish superstar as well as from Tiger Woods who shot an incredible final round of 62 to finish in second place and from Lee Westwood whose 63 took him to fourth. We also look ahead to the second of the WGC events, the Cadillac Championship in Florida in the company of US broadcaster Matt Adams and hear from Paul Casey who is making his comeback after injury. And our tip of the week comes from the South African Thomas Aiken.

item.itunes:summary: This week Robert Lee and Ross McFarlane reflect on the first of the WGC events, the Accenture Match Play Championship in Arizona, won by Hunter Mahan who beat Rory McIlroy in the final. item.itunes:summary: This week Robert Lee and John Hawksworth look back at Jbe Kruger maiden European Tour win at the Avantha Masters in India. We hear from the South African, as well as from Scot Peter Whiteford following his disqualification at the hands of television. item.itunes:summary: This week Robert Lee and John Hawksworth look back at Rafael Cabrera Bellos victory at the Omega Dubai Desert Classic after a nerveless final round. We hear from the Spaniard plus Scotlands Stephen Gallacher who finished in a tie for second and from Marcel Siem of Germany who hung on to finish in 4th place. We also hear from Phil Mickelson who shot a final round of 64 to win the A T & T at Pebble Beach. Jeev Milka Singh tells us what it means to golf in India to host this weeks event the Avantha Masters and our tip of the week comes from Denmarks Soren Hansen.

item.title: Golf - European Tour Race to Dubai Show - Episode 5 - Series 4
item.itunes:summary: This week Robert Lee is joined by Ross McFarlane as Robert Rock beats a world class field to win the Abu Dhabi HSBC Golf Championship, the second title of his career. We hear from the new Champion, from his playing partner the 14 time Major winner Tiger Woods as well as from the Northern Ireland duo of Rory McIlroy and Graeme McDowell who finished 2nd and 3rd respectively. The players stay in the Middle East for this weeks event, the Commercialbank Qatar Masters and defending champion Thomas Bjorn tells us a bit about the challenges theyâ€™ll be facing this week. Plus our tip of the week comes from Austrian Markus Brier.

item.title: Golf - European Tour Race to Dubai Show - Episode 4 - Series 4
item.itunes:summary: This week Robert Lee is joined by Ross McFarlane as Branden Grace follows his first ever European Tour victory with another by clinching the Volvo Golf Champions. We hear from the man who saw off two major winners in an all South African play off as well as from Nicholas Colsaerts and Ryder Cup captain Jose Maria Olazabal. It is an incredibly strong field at the Abu Dhabi HSBC Golf Championship and Padraig Harrington looks ahead to the tournament he was disqualified from last year. Plus our tip of the week comes from Australian Matthew Zions.

item.title: Golf - European Tour Race to Dubai Show - Episode 3 - Series 4
item.itunes:summary: This week Robert Lee is joined by John Hawksworth to look back at Branden Graces maiden tour victory at the Joburg Open. We hear from the Champion as well as speak exclusively to 3 time Major winner Padraig Harrington who helps us look ahead to the next event on the Race to Dubai, the Volvo Golf Champions at Fancourt, George. Plus, our first tip of the new year comes from South African Open Champion Henni Otto.

item.title: Golf - European Tour Race to Dubai Show - Episode 2 - Series 4
item.itunes:summary: This week Robert Lee is joined by John Hawksworth as the 2012 season starts off in much the same way as last year as Louis Oosthuizen retains his title at the Africa Open. We hear from the Champion and from compatriot Charl Schwartzel ahead of the defence of this title at the Joburg Open this week. The Open Champion Darren Clarke tells us what it means to Royal Portrush in Northern Ireland to host this years Irish Open and our first tip of the new year comes from Englands Mark Foster.

item.title: Golf - European Tour Race to Dubai Show - Episode 1 - Series 4
item.itunes:summary: This week Robert Lee is joined by John Hawksworth and US Broadcaster Bob Bubka in a special edition of the European Tour Race to Dubai Show as we reflect on all 4 Major Championships of 2011. It was another triumphant year for Europe with three of the titles in the hands of members of the European Tour - we hear from all four winners: Masters Champion Charl Schwartzel; from Rory McIlroy who recovered from his nightmare final round at Augusta to clinch his first major at the US Open; The Open Champion Darren Clarke; and American Keegan Bradley who took the final major of the year, the US PGA Championship.

item.title: Golf - European Tour Race to Dubai Show - Episode 52 - Series 3
item.itunes:summary: This week Robert Lee is joined by John Hawksworth in a special edition of the European Tour Race to Dubai show as we take time to reflect on the 2011 season which culminated in Luke Donalds incredible achievement of topping both the US and European money lists. We hear from the World Number One as well as from Martin Kaymer who once again proved he is almost unbeatable in the desert, from Spains Sergio Garcia who returned to winning ways with back to back tour victories in his homeland and from Tom Lewis, who won in only his third tour event as a professional.

item.title: Golf - European Tour Race to Dubai Show - Episode 51 - Series 3
item.itunes:summary: This week Robert Lee is joined by John Hawksworth and Ewan Murray as they reflect on a winning end to the year for European Golf with victories for Lee Westwood and Ian Poulter. We hear from Westwood after his first round 60 that helped him win the Thailand Golf Championship. And the guys will be handing out some Race to Dubai Show Awards to celebrate the good, and the not so good, moments of 2011.

item.title: Golf - European Tour Race to Dubai Show - Episode 50 - Series 3
item.itunes:summary: This week Robert Lee and John Hawksworth take a look back at Luke Donalds incredible achievement in becoming the first man to win the European and US money lists in one year. We will hear from the World Number One and from Rory McIlroy who finished second on the Order of Merit. We also hear from Spains Alvaro Quiros on his victory in the last event of the year the Dubai World Championship. And our tip of the week comes from Spains Gonzalo Fernandez Castano.

item.title: Golf - European Tour Race to Dubai Show - Episode 49 - Series 3
item.itunes:summary: This week Robert Lee and John Hawksworth look back at Rory McIlroys win at the UBS Hong Kong Open to ensure a dramatic climax to the 2011 season. Well hear from McIlroy as well as runner up Gregory Havret and from Stephen Dodd who is among those players who lost their playing rights for next season. Well also hear from Lee Westwood who retained his title at the Nedbank Golf Challenge and from Tiger Woods who finally returned to winning ways 749 days since his last victory. Well also look ahead to the final event this season The Dubai World Championship as Luke Donald and Rory McIlroy go head to head.

item.title: Golf - European Tour Race to Dubai Show - Episode 48 - Series 3
item.itunes:summary: This week Robert Lee and John Hawksworth look back at two events on the Race to Dubai as the American pairing of Matt Kuchar and Gary Woodland win the Omega Mission Hills World Cup from England and Germany while Hennie Otto won his national title at the South African Open Championship. We'll hear from Otto as well as Ian Poulter and Justin Rose whose final round of 63 nearly took them to victory on the final day in China. We'll also look ahead to the penultimate event this season the UBS Hong Kong Open in the company of defending champion Ian Poulter.

item.title: Golf - European Tour Race to Dubai Show - Episode 47 - Series 3
item.itunes:summary: This week Robert Lee and John Hawksworth look back at Garth Mulroys win at the Alfred Dunhill Championship and Joost Luiten triumph at the Iskandar Johor Open in Malaysia, we hear from Mulroy as well as from Tiger Woods who earned the winning point as the USA beat the International team 19-15 in the Presidents Cup in Melbourne. We also preview this weeks events, the South Africa Open and the Omega Mission Hills World Cup in China, where we hear from the English pair of Ian Poulter and Justin Rose.

item.title: Golf - European Tour Race to Dubai Show - Episode 46 - Series 3
item.itunes:summary: This week Robert Lee and Ross McFarlane look back at a 5th win on Tour for Gonzalo Fernandez Castano at the Barclays Singapore Open, we hear from the Spaniard after his playoff win in yet another weather affected Barclays event. We also hear from a resurgent Tiger Woods who finished third at the Australian Open, some much needed form after a difficult year. Defending champion Pablo Martin tells us about one of the next events on the Race to Dubai, the Alfred Dunhill Championship. And we preview the Presidents Cup in Australia. Plus our tip of the week comes from German Marcel Siem.

item.title: Golf - European Tour Race to Dubai Show - Episode 45 - Series 3
item.itunes:summary: This week Robert Lee and Ross McFarlane take a look back at the WGC HSBC Champions in Shanghai as Martin Kaymer shot a final round of 63 to take the title. We hear from the new World Number Four as well as from runner up Fredrik Jacobson and Graeme McDowell who finished in third place. We preview the next event on the Race to Dubai, the Barclays Singapore Open and hear from Anders Hansen who enjoys the challenges of golf in the Far East. Plus our Tip of the Week comes from recent European Tour winner in Madrid, Lee Slattery.

item.title: Golf - European Tour Race to Dubai Show - Episode 44 - Series 3
item.itunes:summary: This week Robert Lee and John Hawksworth take a look back at the Andalucia Masters where Sergio Garcia made it back to back wins on the European Tour, we hear more from the in form Spaniard as well from Richie Ramsey and Shane Lowry who finished 3rd and 4th respectively. We also hear from Rory McIlroy who won the lucrative Lake Malaren Shanghai Masters, taking home the richest prize fund in golf in the process. And we look ahead to the next event on the Race to Dubai - the star studded WGC HSBC Champions in Shanghai - with the help of defending champion, Francesco Molinari. Plus our tip of the week comes from Englishman Robert Rock

item.title: Golf - European Tour Race to Dubai Show - Episode 43 - Series 3
item.itunes:summary: This week Robert Lee and Ross McFarlane take a look back at the Castello Masters in Valencia where Spaniard Sergio Garcia destroyed the field in his home tournament to win by an incredible 11 shots, we hear more from the new champion as well from runner-up Gonzalo Fernandez-Castano and 3rd placed Richie Ramsey. We also hear from world number one, Luke Donald, who won the last event of the PGA Tour season, to seal his place at the top of the US Money List. We look ahead to the next event on the Race to Dubai, the Andalucia Masters, with the help of Denmarks Soren Kjeldsen. And our tip of the week comes from Scot, Gary Orr

item.itunes:summary: This week Robert Lee and John Hawksworth take a look back at the Omega European Masters where Thomas Bjorn won his second straight title on the European Tour. We hear from the Dane on his incredible run of form as well as Rory McIlroy and Jamie Donaldson who shared third spot. We also look ahead to this weeks Race to Dubai event, the KLM Open in Holland, and talk to the defending champion Martin Kaymer. And our Tip of the Week this week comes from Thomas Bjorns new caddy Gareth Lord.

item.title: Golf - European Tour Race to Dubai Show - Episode 35 - Series 3
item.itunes:summary: Robert Lee and John Hawksworth look back at the Johnnie Walker Championship at Gleneagles where 40 year old Thomas Bjorn held his nerve in a five man playoff to capture his 12th European Tour title. We hear from the big Dane as well as from George Coetzee and Mark Foster who both just missed out. We preview the next event on the Race to Dubai, The Omega European Masters in Switzerland with the help of a former winner there Bradley Dredge. And our Tip of the Week comes from five time winner on Tour, Barry Lane.

item.title: Golf - European Tour Race to Dubai Show - Episode 34 - Series 3
item.itunes:summary: Robert Lee and Richard Boxall reflect on Oliver Fishers maiden European Tour victory at the Czech Open. The Englishman tells us of his relief after struggling for form for most of the season, missing 20 of the last 21 cuts. We also hear from Swedens Mikael Lundberg, who finished second and Paraguays Fabrizio Zanotti who was a further two shots back. Plus Soren Kjeldsen helps us look ahead to next weeks Johnnie Walker Championship at Gleneagles and Steve Webster shares his tip of the week.

item.title: Golf - European Tour Race to Dubai Show - Episode 49
item.itunes:summary: This week Robert Lee and John Hawksworth look ahead to the first event of the 2010 Race to Dubai season, the Alfred Dunhill Championship in South Africa, a little over two weeks on from the end of the 2009 season. And the guys talk to one of those who will be participating in this second season, Englishman Simon Kahn, who held his nerve to win the Tour Qualifying School. We also look back at two big events that took place last week, the Chevron World Challenge in America and the Nedbank Golf Challenge in South Africa, where Jim Furyk and Robert Allenby were the respective winners. We hear from Furyk as well as Padraig Harrington and Lee Westwood, who finished joint third in America. And our Tip of the Week this week comes from the runner up of the inaugural Race to Dubai, Rory McIlroy.

item.title: Golf - European Tour Race to Dubai Show - Episode 47
item.itunes:summary: This week Richard Kaufman and John Hawksworth look back at the season ending Dubai World Championship where Englishman Lee Westwood secured a superb 6 shot victory and in the process was crowned the inaugural European Tour Race to Dubai winner. We hear from the jubilant champion as well as Race to Dubai runner-up, Rory McIlroy. We also hear from the impressive Ross McGowan who finished behind Westwood at the Earth Course as well as Rookie of the Year, Chris Wood. The guys look ahead to the Omega Mission Hills World Cup in China where 28 nations will be battling it out for the top prize. And our Tip of the Week this week comes from World Number 7, Henrik Stenson.

item.title: Golf - European Tour Race Dubai Show - Episode 29
item.itunes:summary: This week Robert Lee and Richard Boxall reflect on what was a dramatic 138th Open Championship from Turnberry, where American Stewart Cink edged out 59 year old Tom Watson in a play-off to secure his maiden major triumph. We hear from the new champion and veteran Watson who turned back the clock to almost grab an astonishing victory. We also hear from some of the Europeans who ran them close Ã¢â‚¬â€œ Chris Wood, Luke Donald and 16 year-old Italian Amateur Matteo Mannassero who won the Silver Medal with an incredible 13th placed finish. The guys also look ahead to this weeks Senior Open Championship at Sunningdale, with Watson competing again, and the next Race to Dubai Event, the SAS Masters in Sweden. Plus our tip of the week this week comes from South African youngster Brandon Grace.

item.title: European Tour Race to Dubai Golf Podcast - Episode 8
item.itunes:summary: This week Robert Lee and John Hawksworth look back at the Johnnie Walker Classic in Perth, Australia, where 18 year old Korean born Danny Lee became the youngest ever winner on the European Tour! item.itunes:summary: This week, in a special Review of the Year show, Robert Lee and John Hawksworth take a look back at a memorable 2008 European Tour season, discussing everything from Padraig HarringtonÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s extraordinary back-to-back Major wins to the United StatesÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ emphatic victory at the Ryder Cup in Valhalla. We hear from the European Tour Golfer of the Year, Harrington, and the guys also speak to renowned US Broadcaster Bob Bubka for a US view of the 2008 calendar year, including the latest on Tiger WoodÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s recovery from injury. We then also look ahead to what is sure to be a fascinating 2009 with the inaugural and lucrative Race to Dubai reaching its climaxÃ¢â‚¬Â¦.

item.title: European Tour Golf Podcast - Programme 35
item.itunes:summary: Robert Lee and Ross McFarlane look back at the HSBC Champions Event in Shanghai, the first tournament of the new European Tour season and the historic start to The Race to Dubai. And it was a thrilling finish in China with Spaniard Sergio Garcia edging out Ryder Cup team-mate Oliver Wilson in a play-off to get his season off to a great start and climb to Number 2 in the World Rankings in the process. We hear from both Garcia and Wilson, as well as double major winner Padraig Harrington who started his season solidly with an 11th place finish. We also hear from newly crowned Rookie of the Year Pablo Larrazabal who gives us his Tip of the Week.

item.title: European Tour Golf Podcast - Programme 25
item.itunes:summary: This week Robert Lee and John Hawksworth reflect on the big news of the week - the announcement of captain Nick Faldo's two wild card picks that completed Europe's Ryder Cup team. We'll hear from Faldo on why he choose Ian Poutler and Paul Casey and look ahead to Valhalla later on this month. Plus David Howell gives us his tip of the week.

item.title: European Tour Podcast Promo
item.itunes:summary: Former European Tour professional Robert Lee hosts a new weekly show bringing you all the latest news plus a light-hearted look at life behind the scenes on tour. With unparalleled access to all the top players, Robert, with the help of fellow former professionals, will guide you through the European Tour's tournaments each week offering listeners the chance to interact with the team and get their questions answered.
